message_1: Solve the inequality and graph the solution on a number line: 4x - 6 > 18.
message_2:
To solve the inequality 4x - 6 > 18, follow these steps:

Step 1: Add 6 to both sides of the inequality.
4x - 6 + 6 > 18 + 6
4x > 24

Step 2: Divide both sides by 4.
4x/4 > 24/4
x > 6

The solution to the inequality is x > 6.

To graph the solution on a number line:

1. Draw a number line with an open circle at 6 (since x > 6, not x â‰¥ 6).
2. Shade the region to the right of 6, indicating that all values greater than 6 are part of the solution.

The graph will look like this:

<---(----6----)---->

where the open circle represents 6 and the shaded region to the right represents all values greater than 6.
